org.threadly.litesockets

Class TCPClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.threadly.litesockets.Client
      • org.threadly.litesockets.TCPClient
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable

    public class TCPClient
extends Client
    A Simple TCP client.

    • Method Detail

      • setConnectionTimeout

        public void setConnectionTimeout(int timeout)
        Description copied from class: Client
        Sets the connection timeout value for this client. This must be called before Client.connect() has called on this client.
        Specified by:
        setConnectionTimeout in class Client
        Parameters:
        timeout - the time in milliseconds to wait for the client to connect.

      • connect

        public org.threadly.concurrent.future.ListenableFuture<java.lang.Boolean> connect()
        Description copied from class: Client

        Called to connect this client to a host. This is done non-blocking.

        If there is an error connecting Client.close() will also be called on the client.

        Specified by:
        connect in class Client
        Returns:
        A ListenableFuture that will complete when the socket is connected, or fail if we can't connect.

      • hasConnectionTimedOut

        public boolean hasConnectionTimedOut()
        Description copied from class: Client

        This tells us if the client has timed out before it has been connected to the socket. If the client has connected fully this will return false from that point on (even on a closed connection).

        Specified by:
        hasConnectionTimedOut in class Client
        Returns:
        false if the client has been connected, true if it has not connected and the timeout limit has been reached.

      • getTimeout

        public int getTimeout()
        Description copied from class: Client

        Used to get this clients connection timeout information.

        Specified by:
        getTimeout in class Client
        Returns:
        the max amount of time to wait for a connection to connect on this socket.

      • close

        public void close(java.lang.Throwable error)
        Description copied from class: Client

        Closes this client. Reads can still occur after this it called. Client.ClientCloseListener.onClose(Client) will still be called (if set) once all reads are done.

        Specified by:
        close in class Client
        Parameters:
        error - The error that resulted in us closing this client, or null if closing normally

      • getProtocol

        public WireProtocol getProtocol()
        Description copied from class: Client

        This is used by the SocketExecuter to help understand how to manage this client. Currently only UDP and TCP exist.

        Specified by:
        getProtocol in class Client
        Returns:
        The IP protocol type of this client.

      • canWrite

        public boolean canWrite()
        Description copied from class: Client
        Returns true if this client has data pending in its write buffers. False if there is no data pending write.
        Specified by:
        canWrite in class Client
        Returns:
        true if data is pending write, false if there is no data to write.

      • getWriteBufferSize

        public int getWriteBufferSize()
        Description copied from class: Client

        This is used to get the current size of the unWriten writeBuffer.

        Specified by:
        getWriteBufferSize in class Client
        Returns:
        the current size of the writeBuffer.

      • getRead

        public ReuseableMergedByteBuffers getRead()
        Description copied from class: Client

        Whenever a the Client.Reader Interfaces Client.Reader.onRead(Client) is called the Client.getRead() should be called from the client.

        Overrides:
        getRead in class Client
        Returns:
        a ReuseableMergedByteBuffers of the current read data for this client.

      • write

        public org.threadly.concurrent.future.ListenableFuture<?> write(java.nio.ByteBuffer bb)
        Description copied from class: Client

        This is called to write data to the clients socket. Its important to note that there is no back pressure when adding writes so care should be taken to now allow the clients Client.getWriteBufferSize() to get to big.

        Specified by:
        write in class Client
        Parameters:
        bb - The ByteBuffer to write onto the clients socket.
        Returns:
        A ListenableFuture that will be completed once the data has been fully written to the socket.

      • write

        public org.threadly.concurrent.future.ListenableFuture<?> write(MergedByteBuffers mbb)
        Description copied from class: Client

        This is called to write data to the clients socket. Its important to note that there is no back pressure when adding writes so care should be taken to now allow the clients Client.getWriteBufferSize() to get to big.

        Specified by:
        write in class Client
        Parameters:
        mbb - The MergedByteBuffers to write onto the clients socket.
        Returns:
        A ListenableFuture that will be completed once the data has been fully written to the socket.
